readme_file.description: The name of the readme file being analyzed.

overview_is_present.description: TRUE if an overview section is present at the beginning of the README.

overview_mentions_runtime.description: TRUE if the overview gives an estimate of the total runtime for the replication.

data_provenance_is_present.description: TRUE if a section discussing data availability and provenance is present.

data_provenance_no_external_data_is_stat.description: TRUE if the README explicitly states that no external data is used.

data_provenance_rights_statement_is_pres.description: TRUE if any statement about rights to use or redistribute data is included.

data_provenance_rights_claims_permission.description: TRUE if the author certifies legitimate access and permission to use the data.
TRUE if the author certifies permission to redistribute the data in the package.

data_provenance_license_is_present.description: TRUE if a subsection on data licensing is present.

data_provenance_license_summary.description: A brief summary of the data license mentioned (e.g., 'CC-BY-NC', 'Public Domain').

data_provenance_availability_summary.description: The stated summary of data availability.

data_provenance_sources_details_is_prese.description: TRUE if detailed descriptions for individual data sources are provided.

data_provenance_sources_details_uses_tab.description: TRUE if the recommended tabular format (Data.Name, Location, Provided, Citation) is used to list data sources.

dataset_list_is_present.description: TRUE if a section describing each data file in the package is present.

dataset_list_uses_table_format.description: TRUE if a tabular format (Data file, Source, Notes, Provided) is used to list the files.

computational_reqs_is_present.description: TRUE if a section on computational requirements is present.

computational_reqs_software_is_present.description: TRUE if software requirements are listed.

computational_reqs_software_mentions_set.description: TRUE if the README mentions a program/script to install dependencies (e.g., '0_setup.do', 'requirements.txt').

computational_reqs_software_listed.description: A comma-separated list of major software mentioned (e.g., 'Stata, Python, R, Matlab').

computational_reqs_randomness_is_present.description: TRUE if the README mentions controlled randomness or pseudo-random number generator seeds.

computational_reqs_randomness_seed_is_se.description: TRUE if the README states that a random seed is set and ideally where.

computational_reqs_performance_is_presen.description: TRUE if performance requirements (runtime, storage, hardware) are described.

computational_reqs_performance_estimated.description: The approximate time stated to run the analysis (e.g., '1-2 hours', '> 14 days').
The approximate storage space needed (e.g., '250 MB - 2 GB').

computational_reqs_performance_mentions_.description: TRUE if specific hardware (e.g., CPU cores, RAM, OS) used for the analysis is described.

code_description_is_present.description: TRUE if a high-level overview of the program files and their purpose is given.

code_description_license_is_present.description: TRUE if a subsection on code licensing is present.

code_description_license_summary.description: A brief summary of the code license mentioned (e.g., 'MIT', 'GPL').

replication_instructions_is_present.description: TRUE if a section with step-by-step instructions for the replicator is present.

replication_instructions_is_linear_seque.description: TRUE if the instructions are presented as a simple, clear, step-by-step list as recommended by the template.

output_mapping_is_present.description: TRUE if a list or table mapping outputs (tables, figures) to the programs that generate them is present.

output_mapping_reproducibility_claim.description: The claim made about which outputs can be reproduced.

output_mapping_uses_table_format.description: TRUE if the recommended tabular format (Figure/Table #, Program, Output file) is used for the mapping.

references_section_is_present.description: TRUE if a 'References' section is present at the end of the README.

analyst_summary.description: A brief, one-to-three sentence summary of how well the README conforms to the template, noting any major omissions.
